page.title: 17SPORT IN WEST CAMBRIDGESHIRE
page.content:
Obviously such a sparsely-populated rural area has no major sports' facilities. Residents who want squash and tennis courts or swimming pools must seek them outside their immediate neighbourhood, and many do so.
The only organised sport within the area takes place on the playing field at Catworth, where the village football team plays its matches, but, at a less energetic level, the 'Manchester Arms' public house fields teams for pool, table skittles and darts.
Riding, cycling and walking are all popular with local residents, while small children enjoy the playgrounds at Catworth and Stow Longa, which are provided and maintained by the local community.
